DwdDataPrep module

class DwdDataPrep.Reader(path_to_txt, local_path, data_type)[source]

Bases: object

Description

This class will read all the descriptions / informations of all the stations and will generate needed data.

__init__(path_to_txt, local_path, data_type)[source]
Parameters

  • path_to_txt – as string: Is the path to the txt of station descriptions / informations

  • local_path – as string: Is the path to the extracted_files

  • data_type – as string: Is the type of data (Example: “TU” or “SOLAR”)

data_prep_for_new_location(start_date, end_date, x_coordinate, y_coordinate, z_coordinate)[source]
Description

Will prepare all the data that is available in timedelta for a new location

Param

x_coordinate: as float: (GeoLaenge) for the new location

Param

y_coordinate: as float: (GeoBreite) for the new location

Param

z_coordinate: as float: 0 for now (maybe needed in future) for the new location

Returns

x_active_in_date, y_active_in_date, z_active_in_date, activ_id_in_date, station_list: all as list*

get_active_stations()[source]
Description

Will create some important arrays (all active stations, not active stations and stations with no data) for past 10 days

Returns

x_active, y_active, z_active, active_id, x_not_active, y_not_active, z_not_active, not_activ_id, x_no_data, y_no_data, z_no_data, no_data_id: all as array

get_active_stations_in_date(start_date, end_date)[source]
Description

Will create some important arrays (all active stations, not active stations and stations with no data) in timedelta

Param

start_date: as int: YYYYMMDDHHMM

Param

end_date: as int: YYYYMMDDHHMM

Returns

x_active, y_active, z_active, active_id: all as array

Returns

get_station_ids_in_date(start_date, end_date)[source]
Description

Will create a mask for active stations in timedelta

Param

start_date: as int: YYYYMMDDHHMM

Param

end_date: as int: YYYYMMDDHHMM

Returns

activ_stations_in_date_array: as array* (is a mask)

get_station_information()[source]
Description

Will create an array with all the information from the informations-txt

Returns

station_information: as array (“i4”, “i4”, “i4”, “i4”, “f4”, “f4”, “S20”, “S20”)

class DwdDataPrep.Station(stations_array, local_path, data_type)[source]

Bases: object

Description

This class will generate stations as objects with all the given informations.

__init__(stations_array, local_path, data_type)[source]
Parameters

  • stations_array – as array. Is generated by Reader(…).read_station_list()

  • local_path – as string. Is getting from Reader class

  • data_type – as string. Ss getting from Reader class

check_activ_in_date(start_date, end_date)[source]

Description: Will check the station activity in timedelta (True: is activ in timedelta, False: not activ in timedelta)

Parameters

  • start_date – as int: YYYYMMDDHHMM

  • end_date – as int: YYYYMMDDHHMM

Returns

Boolean

check_activitiy()[source]

Description: Will check the activity of the station (was this station activ past 10 days?)

Returns

Boolean

check_data()[source]

Description: Is checking if this station got any data available (0 == no data, 1 == data available)

Returns

0 or 1: as int

class DwdDataPrep.Writer(path_to_txt, local_path, data_type)[source]

Bases: object

Description

This class write some json files. For faster loading times you should write this files after you downloaded and extracted your data.

__init__(path_to_txt, local_path, data_type)[source]
Parameters

  • path_to_txt – as string: Is the path to the txt of station descriptions / informations

  • local_path – as string: Is the path to the extracted_files

  • data_type – as string: Is the type of data (Example: “TU” or “SOLAR”)

write_stations_paths()[source]
Description

Will write two json files in extracted_files (dict_tu_data_path and dict_from_list) with all the dates and all the paths for any station

Returns

path where the data was written
